results.title: Cybernetica
results.creator_credit: James Ritchie, British Transport Films and Peter M Sims
results.brief_description: Three young women converge on Paris, exploring as they travel, the wonders of a new age; the new railway age in which computers defeat by the speed of their decision making and contemporary evils of congestion, pollution and wasted space and time. “We can travel all we want, yet leave the land, the air and the sunshine undisturbed.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Ritchie, British Transport Films and Peter M Sims

results.title: Cyber sisters
results.creator_credit: Declan Eames, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Grey voyagers”.
72 year old Catherine Walshe overcomes depression and agoraphobia to visit the friends she has made via the Internet. Travelling from her home in Ireland she meets her ‘cyber sisters’ and joins them on a spectacular journey across the United States by train. Catherine begins to rebuild her life as she shares the sights of Niagara Falls, the mid-western prairies and the vastness of the Rocky Mountains with her friends.

results.title: Cutting the queue
results.creator_credit: Richard Costain Film Unit and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Gives a comprehensive survey of the work of British civil engineers involved in the construction of the Apapa Wharf extension at Lagos, which was needed to cope with the rapid expansion of Nigeria’s import and export trade.

results.title: Cutting oils and fluids
results.creator_credit: Michael Barden, R.H.R. Productions and Lawrence Crabb
results.brief_description: The composition and qualities of the various types of water-based fluids and neat cutting oils; their function, the importance of selecting the right one for the job, and the benefits derived from good housekeeping and hygiene.

results.title: Cutting of materials
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Barron, Peter Riding and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Approaching Automation”.
This film deals with the cutting of materials, using cutting, milling, drilling, turning. facing and threading machinery. Points out the advantages of pneumatic and electrical equipment over manual labour. Questions the applicability of some methods of cutting in use and sums up the benefits of part and full automation of existing plant.

results.title: Cutout animation
results.creator_credit: Eric Halliday, AFTRS and Davis Johnson
results.brief_description: A very good hands-on type film which will show students a way of getting into animation by some means other than drawing. A similar type of animation as seen in the opening credits of the Monty Python Show is shown.

results.title: Cut or mix
results.creator_credit: Gordon Severn and Centre for Educational Television Overseas
results.brief_description: Shows situations in television production in which the choice between a cut and a mix has to be made and gives some guidelines to assist the director in making the correct decision. In many cases the exact timing of a cut can be important, and examples are shown and explained in detail, showing cutting on action and on change of ideas. Intended for trainee television producers.

results.title: Customer service
results.brief_description: The aim of this manual is to present knowledge and techniques required to develop and maintain on-going service to customers and to convert complaints into appointments to further strengthen customer ties. A video which complements this manual may be borrowed as a separate loan item.
